title: Linux iwconfig Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux iwconfig command, a powerful tool for configuring and troubleshooting wireless network interfaces. Learn how to set up wireless connections, manage network parameters, and diagnose connectivity issues.

meta.title: Linux iwconfig Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Linux iwconfig command, a powerful tool for configuring and troubleshooting wireless network interfaces. Learn how to set up wireless connections, manage network parameters, and diagnose connectivity issues.
meta.keywords: Linux, iwconfig, wireless, network, interface, configuration, troubleshooting

steps.title: Understand the Purpose of iwconfig Command

verify.name: Verify the iwconfig command output
verify.hint: Make sure the output of the `iwconfig` command shows a wireless network interface, such as `wlan0`.

steps.title: Configure Wireless Network Interface Using iwconfig

verify.name: Verify the wireless network interface configuration
verify.hint: Make sure the output of the `iwconfig wlan0` command shows the ESSID "my_wireless_network", the frequency "2.412 GHz", and the bit rate "54 Mb/s".

steps.title: Troubleshoot Wireless Network Issues with iwconfig

verify.name: Verify the wireless signal level
verify.hint: Make sure the wireless signal level is greater than -70 dBm.
